page.title: 05THE WOODMANSEY ECCENTRIC
page.content: Woodmansey's most notorious local character was {Mr. Gillyat Sumner} (1793-1875). Living at number 4, King Street, it seems he had two hobbies-collecting and quarreling. The 'human magpie' as he was known came to be involved in many law suits. The extent of his possessions can be judged from their sale in October 1877. The auction lasted three days and included the sale of 5,000 oil paintings and countless books and manuscripts. His former dwelling can be seen from the car park of the Dixon's Arms. Built into the wall at the side of the house is the fifteenth century doorway of Beverley's ancient{Hanshouse}. Inside the garden is a stone tower from St. Mary's Church, Beverley.
